name: Clockwork Soldier
movement: walks at a speed of 30 ft.
description: The Clockwork Soldier is a medium-sized construct with an unyielding metal body, capable of formidable combat. It wields a halberd in battle.
memorable: Its Intimidating Legions ability makes it particularly fearsome in numbers, enhancing its effectiveness in groups.
goals: To serve in combat and protect allies through overwhelming force.
relations: Often found alongside other Clockwork Soldiers, they function better in groups.
environment: Typically encountered in locations where they are deployed for security or warfare.
strengths: Immunity to poison and psychic damage, various condition immunities, and Magic Resistance provide significant resilience.
weaknesses: Very low intelligence and charisma, hindering its ability to think critically or intimidate without support.
attacks: The Clockwork Soldier attacks with a halberd, dealing slashing damage with a reach of 10 feet.
most_powerful_ability: Overdrive Flurry allows the soldier to unleash four halberd attacks in one action, though it becomes stunned after use.
senses: Has darkvision up to 60 feet, allowing it to see in dim or dark conditions.
skills: It has a good proficiency in Athletics but struggles with Intimidation due to low charisma.
additional_information: Immune to spells or effects that alter its form.
Gains bonuses to Intimidation when surrounded by allies.
Constitution score grants strong health and resilience.
Performs adequately in physical tasks due to decent strength and dexterity.
Well-suited for low-level adventurers as a combat opponent.
test_queries: intimidating construct that works in groups
poison and psychic immune battlefield guardian
